item.title: Bricks and Mortar Apocolypse, Now?
item.description: The physical world is struggling while the virtual world thrives. We may be approaching a point where the internet becomes dominant, and traditional businesses may suffer for unexpected reasons. Retail has been declining, but recently, there’s been a sharp downturn due to rising gas prices. This discourages driving, which leads to less shopping. Shopping is crucial for the economy; a decline in shopping could lead to an economic depression. Our society relies heavily on driving.

item.title: Marco, it's Polo on Your Mobile
item.description: Fashion giant Ralph Lauren is taking shopping to the next level by moving beyond online stores and embracing mobile shopping via cell phones. This shift, known as mobile or m-commerce, is poised to become as significant as e-commerce has been in recent times. Its success relies on internet-enabled smartphones and mobile-friendly websites designed for smaller screens, along with advancements like barcode scanning software and web-connected vending machines. Why the focus on cell phone shopping?

item.title: How to Get a Web Presence For Your Business
item.description: Starting a new business or moving an existing one online can feel overwhelming with all the options available. Is it really worth the effort? Absolutely! Many business owners will attest to the value of establishing an online presence. But it doesn’t have to be complicated.
